alert.note: Alert for Greene; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:29AM CDT until May 15 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL NEWTON...NORTHWESTERN CHRISTIAN...NORTHERN STONE... NORTHERN BARRY...SOUTHERN LAWRENCE AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 1128 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Republic to near Aurora to near Fairview, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 1126 AM wind driven quarter size hail was reported near Aurora. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Republic... Table Rock Lake... Monett... Aurora... Mount Vernon... Marionville... Clever... Crane... Pierce City... Purdy... Billings... Verona... Butterfield... Galena... Fairview... Mccord Bend... Pioneer... Hurley... Halltown... Freistatt... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 45 and 63, and near mile marker 69. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
